titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ مَيْسَرَةَ عَنِ الْحَكَمِ بْنِ عُتَيْبَةَ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ فِي بَيْتٍ مُنَجَّدٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ قَمِيصٌ رَطْبٌ وَ مِلْحَفَةٌ مَصْبُوغَةٌ قَدْ أَثَّرَ الصِّبْغُ عَلَى عَاتِقِهِ فَجَعَلْتُ أَنْظُرُ إِلَى الْبَيْتِ وَ أَنْظُرُ إِلَى هَيْئَتِهِ فَقَالَ يَا حَكَمُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي هَذَا فَقُلْتُ وَ مَا عَسَيْتَ أَنْ أَقُولَ وَ أَنَا أَرَاهُ عَلَيْكَ وَ أَمَّا عِنْدَنَا فَإِنَّمَا يَفْعَلُهُ الشَّابُّ الْمُرَهَّقُ فَقَالَ لِي يَا حَكَمُ مَنْ حَرَّمَ زِينَةَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي أَخْرَجَ لِعِبَادِهِ وَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ مِنَ الرِّزْقِ وَ هَذَا مِمَّا أَخْرَجَ اللَّهُ لِعِبَادِهِ فَأَمَّا هَذَا الْبَيْتُ الَّذِي تَرَى فَهُوَ بَيْتُ الْمَرْأَةِ وَ أَنَا قَرِيبُ الْعَهْدِ بِالْعُرْسِ وَ بَيْتِي الْبَيْتُ الَّذِي تَعْرِفُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Muawiya Bin Mayassar, from Al Hakam Bin Uteyba who said,

‘I went over to Abu Ja’farasws and heasws was in a recently furbished room, and upon himasws was a dyed shirt and a dyed sheet, the effects of the dye being upon his shoulders. So heasws went on to look at the room and looking at its furnishings, so heasws said: ‘O Hakam! What are you saying regarding this?’ So I said, ‘And what I was about to say, and I saw it upon youasws, and as for with us, so it is rather the worn-out youth who are doing it’. So heasws said to me: ‘O Hakam! [7:32] Say: Who has prohibited the adornments of Allah which He has Brought forth for His servants and the good provisions? And this is from what Allahazwj has Brought forth for Hisazwj servants. So As for this room which you see, so it is the ladies chamber, and Iasws am very close to the time of the wedding, and myasws room is the room which you know’.

text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حُمْرَانَ وَ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا ( عليهما السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِلُبْسِ الْمُعَصْفَرِ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Washa, from Muhammad Bin Humran and Jameel Bin Darraj, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,
(It has been narrated) from one of the two<sup>asws</sup> (5<sup>th</sup> or 6<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) having said: ‘There is no problem with wearing the dyed (clothes)’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) ثَوْباً مُعَصْفَراً فَقَالَ إِنِّي تَزَوَّجْتُ امْرَأَةً مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, fromhis father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from hammad, from Zurara who said,
‘I saw upon Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> some dyed clothes, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> (just) married a woman from Qureysh’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) نَهَانِي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) عَنْ لُبْسِ ثِيَابِ الشُّهْرَةِ وَ لَا أَقُولُ نَهَاكُمْ عَنْ لِبَاسِ الْمُعَصْفَرِ الْمُفْدَمِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Al Qaddah,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> forbade me<sup>asws</sup> from wearing the defaming clothes, and I<sup>asws</sup> am not saying he<sup>saww</sup> forbade you all from wearing the dyed, the vibrant-coloured’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ يُكْرَهُ الْمُفْدَمُ إِلَّا لِلْعَرُوسِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from a man,
Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> has said: ‘The vibrant-coloured (clothing) is disliked except for the wedding’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ جَرَّاحٍ الْمَدَائِنِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّا نَلْبَسُ الْمُعَصْفَرَاتِ وَ الْمُضَرَّجَاتِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Al Qasim Bin Suleyman, from Jarrah Al Madainy,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘we<sup>asws</sup> wear the dyed clothes and the reddened (vibrant-coloured) ones’.

text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ بُرَيْدٍ عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ أَعْيَنَ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ عَلَيْهِ مِلْحَفَةٌ حَمْرَاءُ جَدِيدَةٌ شَدِيدَةُ الْحُمْرَةِ فَتَبَسَّمْتُ حِينَ دَخَلْتُ فَقَالَ كَأَنِّي أَعْلَمُ لِمَ ضَحِكْتَ ضَحِكْتَ مِنْ هَذَا الثَّوْبِ الَّذِي هُوَ عَلَيَّ إِنَّ الثَّقَفِيَّةَ أَكْرَهَتْنِي عَلَيْهِ وَ أَنَا أُحِبُّهَا فَأَكْرَهَتْنِي عَلَى لُبْسِهَا ثُمَّ قَالَ إِنَّا لَا نُصَلِّي فِي هَذَا وَ لَا تُصَلُّوا فِي الْمُشْبَعِ الْمُضَرَّجِ
قَالَ ثُمَّ دَخَلْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَ قَدْ طَلَّقَهَا فَقَالَ سَمِعْتُهَا تَبَرَّأُ مِنْ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) فَلَمْ يَسَعْنِي أَنْ أُمْسِكَهَا وَ هِيَ تَبَرَّأُ مِنْهُ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, form Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Bureyd, from Malik Bin Ayn who said,

‘I went over to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and upon him<sup>asws</sup> was a red sheet, new, intensely red. So I smiled when I entered, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is as if I<sup>asws</sup> know why you are laughing. You are laughing at this cloth, which is upon me<sup>asws</sup>. It was the Saqafiyya woman who compelled me<sup>asws</sup> over it, and I<sup>asws</sup> love her, so she compelled me<sup>asws</sup> upon wearing it’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘We<sup>asws</sup> do not Pray in this nor do we<sup>asws</sup> Pray in vibrant colours’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘Then I went over to him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> had divorced her, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> heard her disavowing from Ali<sup>asws</sup>, so there was no leeway for me<sup>asws</sup> that I<sup>asws</sup> should keep her and she disavowed from him<sup>asws</sup>’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْجَارُودِ قَالَ كَانَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَلْبَسُ الْمُعَصْفَرَ وَ الْمُنَيَّرَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Abu Al Jaroud who said,
‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> used to wear the dyed and the radiant (clothes)’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) كَانَتْ لَهُ مِلْحَفَةٌ مُوَرَّسَةٌ يَلْبَسُهَا فِي أَهْلِهِ حَتَّى يَرْدَعَ عَلَى جَسَدِهِ
وَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) كُنَّا نَلْبَسُ الْمُعَصْفَرَ فِي الْبَيْتِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Al Qaddah,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> had a sheet made in Wars (a city), wearing it among his<sup>saww</sup> family until he<sup>asws</sup> turned it upon his<sup>saww</sup> body’.
And he (the narrator) said, ‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘We<sup>asws</sup> wear the dyed clothes in the house’.

text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ صِبْغُنَا الْبَهْرَمَانُ وَ صِبْغُ بَنِي أُمَيَّةَ الزَّعْفَرَانُ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibn Bukeyr, from Zurara,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws having said: ‘Ourasws dyeing is Al-Bahramaan, and the dyeing of the Clan of Umayya is the saffron’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) طَيْلَسَاناً أَزْرَقَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from sahl Bin ZIyad, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Yunus who said,
‘I saw a blue pallium upon Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) ثَوْباً عَدَسِيّاً .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhammad Bin Ali who said,
‘I saw a seed-shaped cloth upon Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ الزَّيَّاتِ الْبَصْرِيِّ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَا وَ صَاحِبٌ لِي وَ إِذَا هُوَ فِي بَيْتٍ مُنَجَّدٍ وَ عَلَيْهِ مِلْحَفَةٌ وَرْدِيَّةٌ وَ قَدْ حَفَّ لِحْيَتَهُ وَ اكْتَحَلَ فَسَأَلْنَاهُ عَنْ مَسَائِلَ فَلَمَّا قُمْنَا قَالَ لِي يَا حَسَنُ قُلْتُ لَبَّيْكَ قَالَ إِذَا كَانَ غَداً فَائْتِنِي أَنْتَ وَ صَاحِبُكَ فَقُلْتُ نَعَمْ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ

فَلَمَّا كَانَ مِنَ الْغَدِ دَخَلْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِذَا هُوَ فِي بَيْتٍ لَيْسَ فِيهِ إِلَّا حَصِيرٌ وَ إِذَا عَلَيْهِ قَمِيصٌ غَلِيظٌ ثُمَّ أَقْبَلَ عَلَى صَاحِبِي فَقَالَ يَا أَخَا أَهْلِ الْبَصْرَةِ إِنَّكَ دَخَلْتَ عَلَيَّ أَمْسِ وَ أَنَا فِي بَيْتِ الْمَرْأَةِ وَ كَانَ أَمْسِ يَوْمَهَا وَ الْبَيْتُ بَيْتَهَا وَ الْمَتَاعُ مَتَاعَهَا فَتَزَيَّنَتْ لِي عَلَى أَنْ أَتَزَيَّنَ لَهَا كَمَا تَزَيَّنَتْ لِي فَلَا يَدْخُلْ قَلْبَكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ فَقَالَ لَهُ صَاحِبِي جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ قَدْ كَانَ وَ اللَّهِ دَخَلَ فِي قَلْبِي شَيْ‏ءٌ فَأَمَّا الْآنَ فَقَدْ وَ اللَّهِ أَذْهَبَ اللَّهُ مَا كَانَ وَ عَلِمْتُ أَنَّ الْحَقَّ فِيمَا قُلْتَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Usman Bin Isa, from Abdullah Bin Muskan, from Al Hassan Al Zayyat Al Basry who said,

‘I and a companion of mine went to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was is a recently refurbished room, and upon him<sup>asws</sup> was a pink sheet, and had trimmed his<sup>asws</sup> beard and applied kohl. So we asked him<sup>asws</sup> certain questions. So when we arose, he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O Hassan!’ I said, ‘At your<sup>asws</sup> service!’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When it is the morning, so come to me, you and your companion’. So I said, ‘Yes, may I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>’.

So when it was the morning, we went over to him<sup>asws</sup>, and he<sup>asws</sup> was in a room in which there was nothing except for a mat and upon him<sup>asws</sup> was a coarse shirt. Then he<sup>asws</sup> faced towards my companions, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O brother of the people of Al-Basra! You came over to me<sup>asws</sup> yesterday and I<sup>asws</sup> was in the wife’s chamber, and yesterday was her day, and the room was her room, and the chattels were her chattels. So she adorned for me<sup>asws</sup> upon (the condition) that I<sup>asws</sup> would adorn for her just as she had adorned for me<sup>asws</sup>, therefore do not let anything enter your heart’. So my companion said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, there had entered something into my heart, so as for now, so by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Removed what was (in my heart), and I know that the truth is in what you<sup>asws</sup> say’.
